oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diversity Oriented Approach to Crownophanes by Enyne Metathesis and Diels-Alder Reaction as Key Steps
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
WAGHULE, GT
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: AMINO-ACID DERIVATIVES
OLEFIN METATHESIS
CYCLIC POLYETHERS
METAL-SALTS
COMPLEXATION
RECOGNITION
MOLECULES
CHEMISTRY
PARAQUAT
1ST
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Various crownophanes are assembled starting with simple phenol derivatives such as catechol, resorcinol, and hydroquinone. Here, cross-enyne metathesis (CEM) and Diels-Alder (DA) reaction have been used as key steps. This strategy has embedded six diversity points.
